title: MERN Stack Development
description: Master full-stack development with MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js.
longDescription: This intensive course covers the complete MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js). You’ll learn to build modern, scalable, and dynamic web applications from scratch. The course includes backend APIs, frontend integration, authentication, and deployment to production servers.

instructor.name: Yamank Dhuriya
instructor.bio: Full-Stack Developer and Instructor with 8+ years of industry experience in JavaScript and web technologies

syllabus.title: HTML Basics
syllabus.goal: Understand the structure of web pages and semantic markup.
topics: Common tags: headings, paragraphs, lists, images, links
syllabus.miniProject: Build a personal profile/portfolio page (static) with a contact form (no backend).
syllabus.practice: Validate markup, use meaningful semantics, inspect with DevTools.

syllabus.title: CSS Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Learn styling fundamentals and layout basics.
topics: Simple layout with floats and positioning
syllabus.miniProject: Style your portfolio page (from Module 1) — header, hero, card sections.
syllabus.practice: Make small style variations and use DevTools to experiment.

syllabus.title: Modern Layouts: Flexbox & Grid
syllabus.goal: Build responsive layouts using modern layout systems.
topics: Flexbox: container & children properties (justify, align, flex-grow/shrink)
CSS Grid: rows/columns, areas, implicit vs explicit grid
syllabus.miniProject: Create a responsive landing page with a 2-column layout that collapses on mobile.

syllabus.title: Advanced CSS & Responsive Design
syllabus.goal: Make polished, responsive UIs.
topics: Introduction to a utility CSS framework (e.g., Tailwind) optional
syllabus.miniProject: Recreate a real landing page (e.g., a small SaaS landing) with responsive behavior.

syllabus.title: JavaScript Basics
syllabus.goal: Understand core JavaScript language features.
topics: DOM basics: selecting elements, reading/writing content, attributes
Event listeners and basic event handling
syllabus.miniProject: Build a To-Do app (vanilla JS): add, delete, mark complete (store in localStorage).

syllabus.title: Modern JavaScript (ES6+) & Async
syllabus.goal: Use modern JS patterns and async code.
syllabus.miniProject: Fetch data from a public API and display it (e.g., GitHub users or quotes). Add loading & error states.

syllabus.title: Tooling, Git & NPM
syllabus.goal: Use dev tools and workflows used in real projects.
topics: Git basics: repo, commits, branches, push/pull
syllabus.miniProject: Initialize a GitHub repo for your To-Do app and deploy a static version (Netlify/Vercel—optional).

syllabus.title: React Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Build component-based UIs with React.
syllabus.miniProject: Convert the To-Do app to React.

syllabus.title: React Advanced
syllabus.goal: Manage side effects, routing and forms.
syllabus.miniProject: Build a small multi-page app (e.g., blog list → post detail) with React Router and fetch data.

syllabus.title: State Management & Patterns
syllabus.goal: Scale React apps with shared/global state.
topics: Introduction to Redux / Redux Toolkit or Zustand (pick one)
Patterns: container vs presentational components, hooks for logic
syllabus.miniProject: Add a global state (favorites/cart) to your app and persist it to localStorage.

syllabus.title: Node.js & Express Basics
syllabus.goal: Create backend APIs to serve data.
topics: Basic project structure for an API
syllabus.miniProject: Build a simple REST API for tasks (CRUD endpoints).

syllabus.title: Databases with MongoDB & Mongoose
syllabus.goal: Persist data with a NoSQL database.
syllabus.miniProject: Connect your Express API to MongoDB and persist the tasks.

syllabus.title: Authentication & Security
syllabus.goal: Secure your app with user auth.
topics: Basic security best practices (CORS, helmet, rate limiting)
syllabus.miniProject: Add user signup/login to your API and protect task routes.

syllabus.title: Connecting Frontend & Backend (MERN Integration)
syllabus.goal: Build full-stack features and integrate apps.
topics: Handling auth tokens in frontend (storage, headers)
syllabus.miniProject: Build a full MERN CRUD app (e.g., notes, blog, or simple e-commerce) with auth and protected pages.

syllabus.title: Testing, Performance & Deployment
syllabus.goal: Make apps production ready.
topics: Basic testing: Jest + React Testing Library (unit & simple integration)
Frontend performance tips (lazy load, asset sizes)
syllabus.miniProject: Deploy your MERN app to a cloud provider and verify end-to-end functionality.

syllabus.title: Advanced Topics & Capstone
syllabus.goal: Add advanced features and finish a capstone project.
topics: Final project planning, code review, README & presentation
capstoneIdeas: Full e-commerce app (products, cart, checkout mock, admin panel)
Social feed app with auth, likes, comments and real-time notifications
Project management app (teams, tasks, file uploads, roles)
syllabus.deliverable: A deployed, tested MERN application with README + demo.

requirements: Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Computer with Node.js installed and internet access
learningOutcomes: Build and deploy full-stack web applications using the MERN stack
Design RESTful APIs and connect them with frontend apps
Implement authentication and authorization in web apps
Deploy production-ready applications on cloud platforms

title: MEAN Stack Development
description: Master full-stack development with MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, and Node.js.
longDescription: This comprehensive course covers the complete MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, and Node.js). You’ll learn to build scalable, responsive, and dynamic applications with a robust backend and interactive frontend. The course includes REST APIs, Angular components, authentication, and cloud deployment.

instructor.name: Priya Sharma
instructor.bio: Full-Stack Developer and Angular Specialist with 10+ years of experience building enterprise-grade applications.

syllabus.title: HTML & CSS Basics
syllabus.goal: Get comfortable with semantic HTML and styling fundamentals.

syllabus.title: JavaScript Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Learn the building blocks of JavaScript.

syllabus.title: Angular Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Build dynamic frontends with Angular.

syllabus.title: Advanced Angular
syllabus.goal: Work with forms, services, and routing.

syllabus.title: Node.js & Express Basics
syllabus.goal: Create backend APIs with Node.js and Express.
syllabus.miniProject: Simple REST API for blog posts.

syllabus.title: MongoDB with Mongoose
syllabus.goal: Persist and query data with MongoDB.
syllabus.miniProject: Connect API to MongoDB for blog posts.

syllabus.title: Authentication & Security
syllabus.goal: Secure apps with user login & JWT.

syllabus.title: Integration & Deployment
syllabus.goal: Combine Angular frontend with Express backend.
syllabus.miniProject: Full MEAN CRUD app with authentication.

requirements: Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
learningOutcomes: Build scalable full-stack applications with Angular and Node.js
Design REST APIs and connect them with frontend Angular apps
Implement secure authentication and authorization
Deploy MEAN stack applications on cloud platforms

title: Full-Stack PHP Development
description: Learn to build full-stack applications using PHP, MySQL, and modern frontend technologies.
longDescription: This course teaches full-stack development with PHP for the backend, MySQL for databases, and modern frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). You’ll learn to create secure, dynamic, and database-driven applications, integrate APIs, handle authentication, and deploy to production servers.

instructor.name: Rahul Verma
instructor.bio: Senior PHP Developer and Instructor with 9+ years of experience in PHP, MySQL, and full-stack web applications.

syllabus.title: HTML & CSS Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Understand the basics of structuring and styling web pages.
syllabus.miniProject: Personal profile page with styled sections.

syllabus.title: JavaScript Basics
syllabus.goal: Learn client-side interactivity using JavaScript.

syllabus.title: PHP Basics
syllabus.goal: Get started with server-side programming using PHP.
syllabus.miniProject: Simple contact form with PHP handling.

syllabus.title: MySQL & Databases
syllabus.goal: Learn database fundamentals and integrate with PHP.
syllabus.miniProject: Guestbook app storing entries in MySQL.

syllabus.title: PHP with MVC Pattern
syllabus.goal: Organize PHP apps with MVC architecture.

syllabus.title: Advanced PHP & Security
syllabus.goal: Enhance apps with authentication and secure coding.

syllabus.title: REST APIs with PHP
syllabus.goal: Build and consume REST APIs with PHP.
syllabus.miniProject: Weather app consuming a public API with PHP backend.

syllabus.title: Deployment & Final Project
syllabus.goal: Deploy PHP applications to cloud hosting.
syllabus.miniProject: Deploy a full-stack PHP CRUD app to the cloud.

requirements: Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
learningOutcomes: Build full-stack applications using PHP and MySQL
Follow MVC architecture and work with a PHP framework
Implement secure authentication and authorization
Deploy PHP applications to production environments

title: Python Programming
description: Learn Python programming from basics to advanced with real-world projects.
longDescription: This course covers Python programming essentials, from syntax and data structures to object-oriented programming, file handling, libraries, and frameworks. By the end, learners will be able to build automation scripts, web apps, and data analysis projects.

instructor.name: Anil Kumar
instructor.bio: Python Developer and Data Analyst with 7+ years of teaching and industry experience.

syllabus.title: Python Basics
syllabus.goal: Get started with Python syntax and data types.

syllabus.title: Data Structures
syllabus.goal: Work with built-in collections.

syllabus.title: Functions & OOP
syllabus.goal: Write reusable code with functions and OOP.

syllabus.title: File Handling & Libraries
syllabus.goal: Use files and libraries effectively.

learningOutcomes: Master Python syntax and data structures
Build automation scripts and console apps
Understand OOP concepts in Python
Use libraries like NumPy and Pandas for data tasks

title: Java Programming
description: Learn Java programming from basics to advanced, covering OOP, collections, and GUI development.
longDescription: This Java course is designed for beginners and intermediate learners who want to master Java programming. It covers syntax, OOP concepts, exception handling, file handling, JDBC, and GUI programming. By the end, learners will be able to build console and desktop applications.

instructor.name: Rohit Mehra
instructor.bio: Senior Java Developer with 12+ years of experience in enterprise applications.

syllabus.title: Java Basics
syllabus.goal: Get started with Java syntax and environment setup.

syllabus.title: Control Structures & Arrays
syllabus.goal: Learn decision-making and looping in Java.

syllabus.title: OOP in Java
syllabus.goal: Understand object-oriented concepts.

syllabus.title: Exception Handling & File I/O
syllabus.goal: Handle errors and work with files.

requirements: Basic programming knowledge helpful but not mandatory
learningOutcomes: Strong understanding of Java syntax and OOP concepts
Ability to handle exceptions and work with files
Build console and desktop Java applications
Knowledge of JDBC and collections framework

title: C Programming
description: Learn the fundamentals of C programming, the foundation of many modern languages.
longDescription: This course covers the basics of C programming, including syntax, operators, control structures, arrays, functions, and pointers. Students will gain a solid foundation for understanding system-level programming and advanced languages like C++ and Java.

instructor.name: Sunil Yadav
instructor.bio: System Programmer and C Language Trainer with 10+ years of teaching experience.

syllabus.title: Introduction to C
syllabus.goal: Learn the basics of C programming.

syllabus.title: Control Structures
syllabus.goal: Write programs with logic and flow control.

syllabus.title: Arrays & Functions
syllabus.goal: Work with arrays and reusable code.

syllabus.title: Pointers & File Handling
syllabus.goal: Understand pointers and files in C.

learningOutcomes: Solid foundation in C programming
Understanding of arrays, functions, and pointers
Ability to build small C projects
Preparation for C++ and system programming

title: C++ Programming
description: Master object-oriented programming with C++ and build real-world applications.
longDescription: This course takes learners from C basics to advanced OOP concepts with C++. Topics include classes, inheritance, polymorphism, templates, STL, and file handling. By the end, learners can build projects using OOP principles and data structures.

instructor.name: Neha Rathi
instructor.bio: Software Engineer and C++ Specialist with 8+ years of experience in application development.

syllabus.title: C++ Basics
syllabus.goal: Set up environment and learn C++ syntax.

syllabus.title: OOP Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Understand object-oriented principles.

syllabus.title: Inheritance & Polymorphism
syllabus.goal: Build advanced OOP applications.

syllabus.title: STL & File Handling
syllabus.goal: Work with templates and file operations.

learningOutcomes: Strong grasp of OOP concepts
Ability to use C++ STL effectively
Build real-world OOP-based applications
Prepare for advanced programming and competitive coding

title: Web Designing
description: Master HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and design principles to create beautiful, responsive websites.
longDescription: This course is designed to teach web designing fundamentals. Students will learn HTML, CSS, JavaScript, responsive design, UI/UX basics, and website deployment. By the end, learners will be able to design professional, mobile-friendly websites.

instructor.name: Sneha Gupta
instructor.bio: Web Designer and Frontend Specialist with 8+ years of experience in UI/UX.

syllabus.title: HTML Basics
syllabus.goal: Learn the structure of web pages.

syllabus.title: CSS Styling
syllabus.goal: Style web pages with CSS.

syllabus.title: JavaScript Basics
syllabus.goal: Add interactivity to web pages.

syllabus.title: Responsive & UI/UX
syllabus.goal: Design mobile-friendly web pages.

learningOutcomes: Ability to design and style professional websites
Understanding of responsive design and UX principles
Hands-on experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Confidence in building portfolio websites

title: Tally with GST & Accounting
description: Learn professional accounting, GST, and business management with Tally ERP software.
longDescription: This course is designed to provide complete knowledge of Tally ERP with GST. Students will learn accounting principles, voucher entries, GST filing, payroll management, inventory management, and advanced features of Tally used in businesses. The program is suitable for students, entrepreneurs, and professionals aiming to build expertise in computerized accounting.

instructor.name: Amit Kumar
instructor.bio: Certified Tally & Accounting Trainer with 10+ years of experience in GST, payroll, and business accounting.

syllabus.title: Fundamentals of Accounting & Tally Introduction
syllabus.goal: Understand basic accounting concepts and get familiar with Tally.
syllabus.miniProject: Create a company in Tally and configure ledgers for business.

syllabus.title: Voucher Entries & Day-to-Day Transactions
syllabus.goal: Record daily business transactions in Tally.
syllabus.miniProject: Enter transactions for a small trading company.

syllabus.title: GST in Tally
syllabus.goal: Apply GST rules and transactions in Tally ERP.
syllabus.miniProject: Record GST-enabled transactions and generate GST reports.

syllabus.title: Inventory & Stock Management
syllabus.goal: Manage inventory with Tally ERP.
syllabus.miniProject: Setup stock items and manage purchase/sales inventory.

syllabus.title: Payroll & Taxation
syllabus.goal: Handle employee payroll and taxation in Tally.
syllabus.miniProject: Generate payroll reports and salary slips for employees.

syllabus.title: Advanced Tally Features & Final Project
syllabus.goal: Work with advanced features and prepare a full business case.
syllabus.miniProject: Complete accounting cycle for a business with GST, payroll, and reports.

requirements: Understanding of fundamental accounting terms is helpful but not mandatory
learningOutcomes: Proficiency in Tally ERP for business accounting
Ability to manage GST billing and returns
Hands-on experience with payroll and inventory management
Skills in generating financial reports and MIS
Confidence in handling day-to-day business transactions in Tally

title: Certificate in Tally Professional with Advanced Excel
description: Master accounting and data analysis using Tally ERP and Advanced Excel tools.
longDescription: This course is designed for students and professionals who want to build strong accounting, GST, and business analytics skills. It covers Tally ERP operations, inventory, payroll, GST, and advanced Excel tools like pivot tables, formulas, macros, and data visualization. Perfect for accounting jobs and freelancing.

instructor.name: Ravi Sharma
instructor.bio: Chartered Accountant and Certified Tally Trainer with 9+ years of teaching experience.

syllabus.title: Tally Fundamentals
syllabus.goal: Learn Tally ERP basics and accounting principles.
syllabus.miniProject: Setup a small business account in Tally.

syllabus.title: GST & Payroll
syllabus.goal: Work with taxation and payroll in Tally.

syllabus.title: Advanced Excel Tools

syllabus.title: Macros & Data Visualization
syllabus.goal: Automate tasks and create reports.

learningOutcomes: Manage accounts, GST, and payroll in Tally
Create advanced Excel dashboards and reports
Automate Excel tasks using macros
Become job-ready in accounting and finance

title: Advanced Diploma in Computer Application (ADCA)
description: A complete diploma course designed to build strong computer fundamentals, office automation skills, programming knowledge, and web development expertise.
longDescription: The Advanced Diploma in Computer Application (ADCA) is a professional course designed for students and working professionals who want to develop strong computer skills. It covers essential topics like computer fundamentals, operating systems, MS Office, programming languages (C, C++, Java, Python), database management, web development, and computer networks. By the end of this program, learners will be ready for IT jobs, freelancing, or higher studies in computer science.

instructor.name: Anita Kapoor
instructor.bio: Computer Science Lecturer with 12+ years of experience in IT training, specializing in programming and office automation.

syllabus.title: Computer Fundamentals & Windows OS
syllabus.goal: Get familiar with the basics of computers and operating systems.
syllabus.miniProject: Create and manage folders & files with shortcuts and settings.

syllabus.title: MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

syllabus.goal: Learn effective internet browsing and communication.

syllabus.title: C Programming
syllabus.goal: Learn the basics of structured programming.
syllabus.miniProject: Write a calculator program in C.

syllabus.title: C++ & Object-Oriented Programming
syllabus.goal: Understand OOP concepts using C++.
syllabus.miniProject: Create a student management system in C++.

syllabus.title: Database Management (DBMS & SQL)
syllabus.goal: Work with databases and SQL queries.
syllabus.miniProject: Build a library database using SQL.

syllabus.title: Web Design with HTML & CSS
syllabus.goal: Build static web pages with HTML and CSS.

syllabus.title: JavaScript & Dynamic Webpages
syllabus.goal: Add interactivity to web pages using JavaScript.

syllabus.title: Java Programming
syllabus.goal: Explore programming with Java.

syllabus.title: Python Programming
syllabus.goal: Learn high-level programming with Python.

syllabus.title: Computer Networking & Security
syllabus.goal: Understand networking concepts and basic security.
syllabus.miniProject: Create a network diagram for a small office.

syllabus.title: Final Project & Deployment
syllabus.goal: Integrate all learned skills into a complete project.
syllabus.miniProject: Develop a complete inventory management system.

learningOutcomes: Strong foundation in computer fundamentals and office automation
Programming skills in C, C++, Java, and Python
Database design and SQL query handling
Web development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Basic knowledge of networking and security
Ability to build and deploy real-world projects
